data.title: Category: Julia Roberts
data.meta_description: Book-based thrilling film "Leave the World Behind" is making history on Netflix. The film is now considered to be Netflix's all-time most popular films list. The film has an impressive 136.3 million...
data.text:
Book-based thrilling film "Leave the World Behind" is making history on Netflix. The film is now considered to be Netflix's all-time most popular films list. The film has an impressive 136.3 million views within its first 52 days on Netflix and has landed on number 8 spot on the list of most popular English film surpassing such film as Glass Onion: A knives Out Mystery and Extraction.

​

The film stars Julia Roberts, Ethan Hawke, and Mahershala Ali.

Sofía Vergara's crime drama series, "Griselda," which explores the rise of cartel leader Griselda Blanco, debuted as the most-watched title of the week, amassing 20.6 million views. Upon its release, all six episodes were made available on January 25th. Last week, "Griselda" secured the top spot as the most-watched English TV series and even reached No. 1 in 89 countries. Its viewership surpassed that of the docuseries "American Nightmare," which ranked second on the English TV list with 13 million views, and the Harlan Coben adaptation "Fool Me Once," settling in third place with 7.6 million views.

Similar Topic: Book-based TV series 'Paranormal' is First Egyptian show on Netflix

Returning fan favorites include "The Brothers Sun" at sixth place with 1.9 million views, now in its fourth week on the list, and book-based Series "My Life with the Walter Boys" sitting comfortably at the tenth spot during its eighth week with 1.5 million views.

Oscar-nominated, book-based film "Society of the Snow" dropped to third place on the list of non-English films with 10.6 million views after being in the lead last week. The Korean action movie "Badland Hunters" now reigns over the list with a staggering 14.3 million views. German drama "Sixty Minutes" sits between "Badland Hunters" and "Society of the Snow" in second place, accumulating 13.5 million views.

​Source: Yahoo
